The claim originated from a news organiz: Zee News, which reported that hundreds of birds were killed in the Netherlands due to 5G testing.
The source of the claim: Zee News, cited a Californian website called Galactic Connection as their source of information.
Snopes: an American fact-checking website, investigated the claim and found that it was based on an article published by a "medical conspiracy blog" called Health Nut News by Erin Elizabeth.
Snopes concluded that the bird deaths in: Netherlands, could not be linked to 5G cellular network testing and that the Consumer Product Safety Authority was investigating possible viruses and poisoning as the cause.
